narrative.title: Ritual to Return Home
paragraphs: Stitch gathered the stuffies close and told them the moment had come to return home. They formed a circle and held paws, steadying themselves. Together, they began to recite Marietta’s rhyme, trusting it would guide them safely back to their child.

vocabulary.definition: The feet of animals, often soft and padded.
examples: The puppy placed its paws on her knee.

vocabulary.definition: To say something out loud from memory.

events.text: A member of the group announces it is time to leave this realm.
Everyone prepares by forming a circle.
They speak the guiding words together.
Their joined gesture completes the ritual.

distractors: The group prepares for a long climb instead.
A balloon appears to take them elsewhere.
A stranger offers to lead them home.
